sentences: Jaap (or Jakob) Kunst  (12 August 1891 in Groningen – 7 December 1960 in Amsterdam) was a Dutch ethnomusicologist, particularly associated with the study of gamelan music of Indonesia.

Jaap (or Jakob) Kunst  (12 August 1891 in Groningen – 7 December 1960 in Amsterdam) was a Dutch ethnomusicologist, particularly associated with the study of gamelan music of Indonesia. He is known for coining the word "ethno-musicology" (which later became ethnomusicology) as a more accurate alternative to the then-preferred term, "comparative musicology".
Kunst was the only child of two musicians, and began to study the violin at only 18 months old.
He earned a degree in law from the University of Groningen in 1917, and pursued a career in banking and law for the next two years.
While touring with a string trio the Dutch East Indies, he decided to remain on Java, and found a government post in Bandung.
Meanwhile, he became interested in the Indonesian music, especially that of Java.
Around von Hornbostel's Theory of the Cycle of Blown Fifths (Amsterdam, 1948)
Kultur-historische Beziehungen zwischen dem Balkan und Indonesien (Amsterdam, 1953, English translation, 1954)
